Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2017 09:34PM solitude wrote: Hi Katie, I can relate. I had my biopsy, idc, lumpectomy and SNB. I'm waiting for final pathology, it's tough. hang in there
Posts.Title: Waiting for all the test Katidid193 solitude

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2017 03:25PM - edited Jun 23, 2017 04:13PM by solitude I started the same regime with Neulasta injection after each infusion. First chemo considerable bone pain. Overall severe flu like symptoms. First and second day manageable then the next 3 days horrible. Second infusion June 16th different. I started taking claritin three days prior to chemo and continued 3 days after. I realized I did not take the correct amount of steroid the first time. I also waited 48 hours for my Neulasta injection. The symptoms much more manageable. I was still unwell with severe stomach cramps, no appetite, headache and flu like symptoms lingered for 7 days. Still happening.
Posts.Title: Cytoxan Taxotere Chemo Ladies- May 2017 rdsm Engine104

Posts.Content: solitude wrote: Dx with invasive ductal carcinoma with possible spread to axilla. I had lumpectomy and SNB April 7th. I have an appointment with surgeon oncologist April 26th for final pathology & treatment plan. I've read all the imaging results and medical notes. I'm exhausted wondering whether my nodes are affected. Despite trying I can't seem to stop obsessing about the outcome. The MRI said nodes looked good. The surgeon removed 6 nodes. He said they look good however they were firm and initial ultra sound showed concern in a node. Anyone else have this dilemma and what was the outcome? Chemotherapy 5/26/2007 AC + T (Taxotere) Radiation Therapy 9/5/2007 Whole-breast: Breast Dx 3/14/2017, IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/12 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ (IHC) Surgery 4/7/2017 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Targeted Therapy 5/27/2017 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Hormonal Therapy 10/1/2017 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for final biopsy following lumpectomy & SNB solitude BC401

Posts.Content: May 2, 2017 03:31PM solitude wrote: thanks for the comments. the good news is my surgical pathology concluded margins and nodes are clear. the tumour was larger than anticipated and quite deep and grade 3. still waiting for pathology feedback on receptors. the results are in and waiting to hear outcome. i have appointments set up with Medical & Radiation Oncologists. it feels like it's taking forever to get my complete diagnosis.
Posts.Title: Waiting for final biopsy following lumpectomy & SNB solitude BC401

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2017 10:09PM solitude wrote: I had the same concerns. I did ask the radiologist to explain bi-rads while Ã¬ was having the ultra sound guided biopsy. I had also checked on-line. I understood it to mean the likelihood or unlikelyhood of it being cancer. I had bi-rads 3 and it was cancer. I had a lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy on April 7th. I'm waiting for the pathology for my treatment plan.
